result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin David Trone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Martin David Trone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Martin David Trone was found guilty of Retail Theft - Remove Anti-Theft Device (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500), Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin David Trone

records.addlTxt:
Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Craig R. Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in person in custody with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Matter set over to allow defense to consider proposed plea agreement.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Joseph Pecora appearing on behalf of defendant.
Martin David Trone, defendant does not appear.
Gary L. Luhman appearing as prosecuting attorney.

Violation: Retail Theft-remove anti-theft device; Misd. Retail Theft; Intentionally take; Felony Bail Jumping
Issuing Agency: Monroe Police Department
Conditions: NO CONTACT WITH: Wal-Mart Supercenter, 300 6th Ave West, Monroe or its parking lot. May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County without permission of Court, except to travel to Stephenson County for a pending criminal case and to Beard Town, Cass County, IL to visit his ill uncle. Mr Pecora to notify Clerk of Courts the dates the defendant will travel to Cass County before he travels there. Defendant shall immediately complete processing at the Monroe Police Department.
